blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary:
Shireen: What should I be for halloween?
Arya, under her breath: My girlfriend.
Shireen: What was that?
Arya, out loud:...
body:
Shireen: What should I be for halloween?

Arya, under her breath: My girlfriend.

Shireen: What was that?

Arya, out loud: Stonehenge.

summary:
Myrcella: Maybe we should stop. This is Sansa's room. And she’s right downstairs.
Arya: Do you remember the Independence Day...
body:
Myrcella: Maybe we should stop. This is Sansa’s room. And she’s right downstairs.

Arya: Do you remember the Independence Day party I had at my house last year when Sansa and Margaery had just came out as dating?

Myrcella: Yeah..?

Arya: Do you remember how I went upstairs to get you a blanket from my room, and when I came back down, I was grumpy and blanket-less?

Myrcella: Yeah…

Arya: Yeah. This is revenge sex.

Myrcella: …at least you want me for more than because I’m hot or something.

Arya: Well, I mean, you are really hot…but it was more important that you’re the only person I know who’d condone revenge sex.

summary:
sansa: “What happens if you put a werewolf on the moon” is a great question. Probably the best question ever.
Bran: he’d explode...
body:
sansa: “What happens if you put a werewolf on the moon” is a great question. Probably the best question ever.

Bran: he’d explode and die because there’s no oxygen on the moon.

arya: We never said we’d send him up without a suit, you absolute monster.

title: Lovely Bear
body:
The bear was towering over him, standing on his hind legs. For a moment it stared at him fiercely, baring its teeth. A guttural roar exited its throat, a sound as terrifying as anything Jaqen had ever heard. He struggled with the bear, using all the strength he had in his arms. The beast roared again and grabbed him before tossing him to the ground. He fought bravely but the bear did its best to defeat him. In his last breath he uttered the girl’s name…

Jaqen woke up with a start, not knowing where he was. It took a moment for his eyes to adjust to the darkness around him. Slowly he recognized the room and he remembered they were at their lake house.

He felt lovely girl’s head heavy on his chest. The girl of his dreams, the light of his life, his beloved one was snoring as loud as a bear.

He took a couple of deep breaths to calm his pounding heart. Nymeria moved in her spot by the bed. She raised her head, yawned and grinned at him.

‘You’re right, Nan.’ He murmured. 'That’s what I wanted.’

How could a girl so small produce such powerful sound, he wondered. Arya let out another snore. Jaqen put his arm around her shoulders and kissed her hair softly. Then, as gently as he could, he rolled her to the other side of the bed.

She shuffled back to him seconds later and, clinging to his side, demanded sleepily :

'Give me your body heat !’

Jaqen sighed and reached to the bedside table. He opened a drawer, found the ear plugs and put them into his ears. Things we do for love !

The beast roared again and grabbed him before tossing him to the ground. He fought bravely but the bear did its best to defeat him. In his last breath he uttered the girl’s name…

blog.name: thestagthatlovedthewolf
blog.title: My obsessions
blog.description: Joana | Veridissima | 22 | Portuguese | Slytherin | Demigod | Born in Idris | Raised aboard the Millenium Falcon | Lived in District 6 | Died in Westeros | Multifandom blog (if it wasn't obvious before), but mostly ASOIAF!!!

summary: Hiii, could you write an story that robb have a twin sister, but since she have magic, she was send away to a company that take...
question: Hiii, could you write an story that robb have a twin sister, but since she have magic, she was send away to a company that take care of wizards, and this company ask to the mister to say to cat that the girl was born dead after erasing her memory of the baby. Later the same girl saves Ned and her sisters, and together the four saves Cat and Robb from the Red Wedding.
answer:
I’ve said before, I’m not a big fan of OCs and made up siblings, but I didn’t want to say no and I wanted to do something, and I hope this works out for you :)

River grew up knowing she would have a purpose in life - it had been written in the stars - but she was still surprised the day a bad was thrown over her head and she was sent by ship to Westeros, to King’s Landing, with a simple mission, save the Starks.

The Starks were hers. She was a Stark, she had always known, raised by wizards and taken from her mother the day she was born, like many with magic were if they were unlucky enough to be born in Westeros. Her own name reflected her origins, Riverrun, named after the place where she was born - she had a Tully name for her Stark features, long dark hair with grey eyes, but with the high cheekbones of a Tully.

River arrived to the westerosian capital the day of her father’s judgement, she knew from her visions that she needed to save him before that. The plan was to get Sansa first, they would be looking for her in the castle then, and the confusion would make things easier to get to their father.

She knew how to pretend to someone from the help and she slipped into her sister’s room when she was alone.

“Who are you?” she asked scared.

“I came here to help you. To save your father.”

“My father will confess and the King will pardoned him.”

“He won’t. He will behead yout father.”

“He won’t. He told me,” she started, “I’ll scream.”

“Sansa,” she whispered, touching her arm, calming her, showing her those emotions and giving them to her, and then showed her the visions and memories - her all story in that. That was her power, visions and being able to show people or make them feel something by touch.

“You’re my…” she said with tears in her eyes.

“Yes, and we need to get Father.”

“We do,” Sansa agreed and they started their plan. They left the room after than, in servant clothes, and with the call that Sansa was missing through the castle, every guard moved up to look for her, leaving the Dark Cells almost clear.

“Sansa, wait here,” River told her, she walked through the cells and touched the guards, making them fall asleep. “Come in, Sansa,” she called as she got the key from one of the guards.

River opened the door after that, and told Sansa to go in first, and then she ran to her father’s arms, whispering things on his ear. And then he looked up, at River standing there, as Sansa told him who she was.

“You were stillborn,” he whispered, “Your mother said…”

“Nobody knew, she saw an illusion of my body, so did the Maester, when I was taken…” she said, “I’m back now,” she said, offering her hand to her Father, pushing her memories to him, leaving him speechless.

“We can’t do this now, Father. We need to get Arya and leave King’s Landing, before they figure that you’re missing too.”

River led them through the city, pulling for visions of Arya, knowing that she would be in the next corner, and send Father and Sansa in the front. River waited from the back as they hugged each other and celebrated the fact that they were alive. But she knew they were nowhere done - Mother and Robb had already done the deal with the Freys, and it wouldn’t be that long before Robb sent Theon home and then met Jeyne - things needed to be changed now. There was a war to win and a family to keep together.

“Come here, River, come meet your sister,” her father called, putting her worries aside for a moment.
answer_abstract:
I’ve said before, I’m not a big fan of OCs and made up siblings, but I didn’t want to say no and I wanted to do something, and I hope this works out for you :)

trail.content:
I’ve said before, I’m not a big fan of OCs and made up siblings, but I didn’t want to say no and I wanted to do something, and I hope this works out for you :)

River grew up knowing she would have a purpose in life - it had been written in the stars - but she was still surprised the day a bad was thrown over her head and she was sent by ship to Westeros, to King’s Landing, with a simple mission, save the Starks.

The Starks were hers. She was a Stark, she had always known, raised by wizards and taken from her mother the day she was born, like many with magic were if they were unlucky enough to be born in Westeros. Her own name reflected her origins, Riverrun, named after the place where she was born - she had a Tully name for her Stark features, long dark hair with grey eyes, but with the high cheekbones of a Tully.

River arrived to the westerosian capital the day of her father’s judgement, she knew from her visions that she needed to save him before that. The plan was to get Sansa first, they would be looking for her in the castle then, and the confusion would make things easier to get to their father.

She knew how to pretend to someone from the help and she slipped into her sister’s room when she was alone.

“Who are you?” she asked scared.

“I came here to help you. To save your father.”

“My father will confess and the King will pardoned him.”

“He won’t. He will behead yout father.”

“He won’t. He told me,” she started, “I’ll scream.”

“Sansa,” she whispered, touching her arm, calming her, showing her those emotions and giving them to her, and then showed her the visions and memories - her all story in that. That was her power, visions and being able to show people or make them feel something by touch.

“You’re my…” she said with tears in her eyes.

“Yes, and we need to get Father.”

“We do,” Sansa agreed and they started their plan. They left the room after than, in servant clothes, and with the call that Sansa was missing through the castle, every guard moved up to look for her, leaving the Dark Cells almost clear.

“Sansa, wait here,” River told her, she walked through the cells and touched the guards, making them fall asleep. “Come in, Sansa,” she called as she got the key from one of the guards.

River opened the door after that, and told Sansa to go in first, and then she ran to her father’s arms, whispering things on his ear. And then he looked up, at River standing there, as Sansa told him who she was.

“You were stillborn,” he whispered, “Your mother said…”

“Nobody knew, she saw an illusion of my body, so did the Maester, when I was taken…” she said, “I’m back now,” she said, offering her hand to her Father, pushing her memories to him, leaving him speechless.

“We can’t do this now, Father. We need to get Arya and leave King’s Landing, before they figure that you’re missing too.”

River led them through the city, pulling for visions of Arya, knowing that she would be in the next corner, and send Father and Sansa in the front. River waited from the back as they hugged each other and celebrated the fact that they were alive. But she knew they were nowhere done - Mother and Robb had already done the deal with the Freys, and it wouldn’t be that long before Robb sent Theon home and then met Jeyne - things needed to be changed now. There was a war to win and a family to keep together.

“Come here, River, come meet your sister,” her father called, putting her worries aside for a moment.

I’ve said before, I’m not a big fan of OCs and made up siblings, but I didn’t want to say no and I wanted to do something, and I hope this works out for you :)

River grew up knowing she would have a purpose in life - it had been written in the stars - but she was still surprised the day a bad was thrown over her head and she was sent by ship to Westeros, to King’s Landing, with a simple mission, save the Starks.

The Starks were hers. She was a Stark, she had always known, raised by wizards and taken from her mother the day she was born, like many with magic were if they were unlucky enough to be born in Westeros. Her own name reflected her origins, Riverrun, named after the place where she was born - she had a Tully name for her Stark features, long dark hair with grey eyes, but with the high cheekbones of a Tully.

summary: Sorry, I should have been clearer. What I meant by "easy" is that when it comes to the series villains, even when they get their...
question: Sorry, I should have been clearer. What I meant by "easy" is that when it comes to the series villains, even when they get their comeuppance it seems like it happens more as a form of poetic justice rather than as direct vengeance or retribution by the heroes that they wronged. I feel - and perhaps I'm wrong - like GRRM generally seems reluctant to write the latter, to give readers that bit of visceral satisfaction.
answer:
No, no, I got you. I could have been clearer myself. What I mean is that Catelyn’s personal fate is the very thing that will undermine the visceral satisfaction of seeing Walder meet his own fate - whether that fate is death, or being left the only Frey alive to witness the ruin of his family. Lady Stoneheart might succeed in getting that revenge, but she won’t get peace from her actions. The apology won’t mend things, and what joy it brings will be fleeting. 

My speculation is that Arya will lay Lady Stoneheart to rest (or at least witness it), and in knowing that at least one of her children lives, what remains of Catelyn Stark will finally know peace.

summary: Asoiaf fandom heteronormative af I see!!! A woman doesn't need a man in her life to be happy and fulfilled! Women are whole,...
question: Asoiaf fandom heteronormative af I see!!! A woman doesn't need a man in her life to be happy and fulfilled! Women are whole, complete people!!!! Fuck all the way off!!! (Not @u obv)
answer:
Yeah. Game of Thrones fandom remains Extra when it comes to female characters.

In regards to Arya specifically though so many people misunderstand her character. She doesn’t lack empathy, or is unfeeling or some serial killer. She’s a child who has gone from one traumatic experience to another and had to adapt or die. The view that Arya doesn’t want a relationship ever is myopic and willfully misunderstanding.

Arya doesn’t want to become what she’s seen happen to so many other women in her life. She would’ve grown up knowing that Catlyn only married Ned because Brandon was killed by the Mad King. Her existence was dependent on the murder of her uncle. She would’ve grown up hearing how Rhaegar abducted and raped Lyanna which resulted in her death. Robert’s prolific infedility to Cersei was not a secret by any means. Her sister was abused by Joffery, used by Littlefinger, married off to Tyrion because it was useful to Tywin and in the show she’s raped by Ramsey. Do people think these things wouldn’t affect her? That society wouldn’t color Arya’s views on highborn marriages? Even if Ned and Catlyn’s own marriage turned out unexpectedly well there was still the cloud of the fact that Ned apparently had a bastard son the same age as his trueborn son. 

All of this and then people wonder why Arya doesn’t want to be married to some random ass lord. Arya wants to make her own destiny and choose for herself what she wants from life. 

As for Arya and Gendry. To me, all signs point to this being a romantic relationship. Narratively they hit all the tropes and in the show they frame it as such. I think the reason there wasn’t a reunion or any mention of Arya by Gendry to either Jon or the Hound is because they want to hold out on the payoff until the very last season. Arya’s experiences haven’t tarnished her, haven’t made her unlovable, or made her not want love in return. So. All in all. These people who think and believe that Arya is some sort of badass killing machine and that’s all she could ever or want to be is — well, it’s sad to me.

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

title: Arya Stark and romance
body:
A large part of the asoiaf/got community can’t see Arya having a love interest and is under the misconception that she is vehemently against romance,too. I think that not even entertaining the possibility that Arya could find romantic partner in her life (when both books and show have given her a potential love interest) stems from the sexist belief  that tomboy girls aren’t interested in romance  and much worse that they aren’t capable to inspire love because of their interests. Thankfully, Martin doesn’t share this opinion as he has written female  who don’t adhere to patriarchal standards of how women should behave who still are interested in romance/marry/have children. A good example would be  Visenya and Rhaenys Targaryen, the very women Arya admired, who were both warrior ladies and also married and became mothers. Same can be said about Brienne of Tarth and Daenerys Targaryen from the current timeline. Both ladies participate in battles and that didn’t stopped them from falling in love with someone.

Usually, when someone wants to support the opinion that Arya is disinterested in romance they bring up this quote:

Arya cocked her head to one side. “Can I be a king’s councilor and build castles and become the High Septon?”

“You,” Ned said, kissing her lightly on the brow, “will marry a king and rule his castle, and your sons will be knights and princes and lords and, yes, perhaps even a High Septon.”

Arya screwed up her face. “No,” she said, “that’s Sansa." 

First of all, let me begin by saying that Arya is only nine years old during that conversation with Ned. She’s too young to know the concept of romantic love- and of course she had never been in love up to that point. I think we should take with  grain of salt what a kid says about marriage. Opinions change through the years and Arya isn’t the same child she was back in book 1/season 1. 

Furthermore, in this specific quote she doesn’t even reject the concept of finding a loving partner. She rejects being what the patriarchal standards of Westeros want her to be: a ladywife whose only worth can be measured by her husband/sons’ achievements. She has some ambitions of her own and she has every right to do so. 

Some people (although I admit that thankfully not many) also bring up her lack of enthusiasm for romantic tales as evidence that she won’t experience love. Which doesn’t make sense. Just because someone doesn’t care about romance in the stories they consume that doesn’t mean that they don’t want someone to love and love them in return. 

In conclusion, Arya is totally capable of falling in love (like every other person) and it’s not impossible for her to have a love interest as part of her endgame. After all, her story is full of romantic undertones (but this I guess is a topic for another post :’D).

tags: this isn't an attack or anything
summary: Am I the only one who noticed that the word ‘’stupid’’ shows up a lot in Arya chapters? I made my research and apparently...
body: Am I the only one who noticed that the word ‘’stupid’’ shows up a lot in Arya chapters? I made my research and apparently there’s 88 use of that word in her chapters. In total, it is used 235 times, which means that 37,4% of the time the word is used, it’s used in her chapters, when she only has around 10% of the chapters in the story.

summary: I literally cannot comprehend Arya hate.  I may have to venture into these dark corners of tumblr just to figure out what sort...
body: I literally cannot comprehend Arya hate. I may have to venture into these dark corners of tumblr just to figure out what sort of person hates my bean.

blog.name: aryajon
blog.title: Arya and Jon
blog.description: This fansite is dedicated to Arya Stark and Jon Snow from the show Game of Thrones and the novel series A Song of Ice and Fire. Tracking #aryajon.

summary: do you ship arya and jon like romantically
question: do you ship arya and jon like romantically
answer:
This is a source blog that posts all content for Arya and Jon. 

If you’re curious as to what pairing each of our members ship, I suggest asking them on their individual blogs.

-Chaitali

blog.title: Do I look like a fucking Umber ?
blog.description: This blog is dedicated to our favorite piece of trash, Ramsay Bolton. You can check out my writings here:  https://www.fanfiction.net/u/10200368/Polychromatique

summary: Robb: Good morning. Sansa: Good morning. Bran: Good morning. Rickon: You all sound like robots, “good morning, good morning,”...
body:
Robb: Good morning.

Sansa: Good morning.

Bran: Good morning.

Rickon: You all sound like robots, “good morning, good morning,” spice it up a bit!
Arya: Hey, motherfuckers!
